title: I love Bjork
body: There's simply not enough hours in the day, I tells ya. As we get closer and closer to opening day, I find that I have fewer and fewer free hours to surf internet porn and play Tetris. It's ridiculous! Today is particularly busy, so this post is going to be comprised of several little blurbs... each one better and/or worse than the last. CAFFEINE! I'm so busy that I don't even have time to drive down the road to buy my daily dose of Dr. Pepper. Instead, I'm drinking a half-empty bottle of Diet Pepsi that one of my parents left in the back of our refrigerator in early January. Now that's what I call BUSY! Gettin' plastered My dad and I finished plastering the West wall (not to be confused with the West Wing) yesterday. I never knew slinging mortar could be so fun! Also, a big thanks to J.R. for dropping by to lend a hand on Saturday. THANK YOU! Where are we on the building permit? Good question. I was instructed to go here to find out. Don't let the Health Department's comments scare you... that's all being remedied with an addendum that should be submitted today. I hope. Check out the budget sheet Why? Because 1) I added some new CLICKABLE buttons, 2) it will soon have many, many more little items added to it, and 3) one of my readers was kind enough to purchase the 65mm Cinemascope lens for us (Thanks Shannon!). Isn't that a great?! The answer is yes. It's very, very, VERY great. Our first marketing campaign Printer cartridges - $40 Nice thick paper and lickless envelopes - $18 200 John Wayne stamps - $74 Having Triscuits and a half-empty Diet Pepsi for lunch - Pathetic Seriously though, our first big marketing campaign is about to hit the streets. Instead of sending out letters urging people to buy advertising space from us, we're just going to send out a brief introductory letter that tells locally owned, downtown businesses a little about the Moxie and gives them a channel to contact us with questions regarding cross-promotions, advertising, sponsorships, or anything else they'd like to discuss. At this point in the game, I think well-forged relationships with our downtown neighbors are worth more than a few monthly pre-show contracts. Mike: We saw you at the post office yesterday... thanks for the nice quote in Nathan's upcoming article! For those of you who have no idea what I'm talking about... you soon will. F---ing server It looks like my server's back up. They did some stuff to one of the deals where my junk was stored, and now the thing is working pretty good... er, well. Pretty well. I almost had to jump ship and take my hosting business somewhere else. Is somewhere one word? It should be. Ok, my pre-alloted 15 minutes of blog writing time is up. I'm going to go buy a Dr. Pepper now. PS - Keep your eyes out for a new phlog or two in the near future.
author: Dan
